page.title: 06Transport
page.content: In Bricket Wood there is a railway station;the line runs between Watford Junction and St Albans Abbey.It was built for steam trains,carrying passengers and it also carried coal for the gas works in St Albans. On Sundays a lot of Sunday School outings travelled to Bricket Wood for picnics and walks in the woods.Nowadays,there is a half-hourly diesel drawn passenger train,mainly taking commuters to and from Euston via Watford. Commuters also use the nearby M1 to travel to London by car. The last stretch of the M 25 is now being built,which,with M1,will give the area excellent road links with the whole country.
